title: Business Live: Aldi to take old £1 beyond Sunday - BBC News
summary: aldi will continue to take old £ 1 coin for further fortnight .
energy price cap needs legislation , ofgem says .

documents.title: good night
text: many thanks for joining us for another day of business live coverage .
we hope you 'll click on us again tomorrow morning from 06:00 , when we 'll bring you all the latest news , reaction and analysis from the world of business .

documents.title: imf warns on financial stability
text: the international monetary fund ( imf ) says in a report published on wednesday that the risks to global financial stability in the near future have declined , but it warns of increasing risks over the longer term .
the report says that stronger economic growth is reducing the immediate danger of financial turbulence .
it means that borrowers are less likely to get into difficulty and lenders are at less risk of incurring serious losses .
but the imf also has a warning .
the very low interest rates and other central bank policies that have underpinned the economic recovery have also led many investors to seek better returns by buying riskier assets .
and as policies return to normal and interest rates are increased there 's more danger of borrowers struggling and causing their creditors a problem .
author: Andrew Walker
World Service economics correspondent

documents.title: wall street stocks close at record highs
text: shares on wall street clawed back earlier losses to finish ahead on wednesday , with all three main indexes hitting record closing highs .
the dow jones rose 42.21 points to close at 22,872.89 , while the s & p 500 went up 4.6 points to 2,555.24 .
meanwhile , the tech-heavy nasdaq gained 16.3 points to 6,603.55 .

documents.title: trump wants to be 'very creative ' with nafta
text: president trump said negotiations with canada and mexico on nafta could go either way .
it 's possible we wo n't be able to reach a deal with one or the other .
but in the meantime , we 'll make a deal with one .
but i think we have a chance to do something very creative that 's good for canada , mexico and the united states .

documents.title: trump : 'we 'll see what happens with nafta '
text: more from that meeting between canadian pm justin trudeau and donald trump .
president trump was asked if nafta was dead .
this is what he said .
we 'll see what happens .
it 's possible we wo n't be able to make a deal , and it 's possible that we will .
we have a relationship now as two countries , i think that 's as close as ever .
but we 'll see if we can do the kind of changes that we need .
we have to protect our workers , and in all fairness , the prime minister wants to protect canada and his people also .
so we 'll see what happens with nafta .
but i 've been opposed to nafta for a long time in terms of the fairness of nafta .
i said we 'll renegotiate .
and i think justin ( trudeau ) understands this - if we ca n't make a deal , it will be terminated and that 'll be fine .
they 're going to do well , we 're going to do well .
but maybe that wo n't be necessary , but , it has to be fair to both countries .

documents.title: us-canada trade pact minus mexico ?
text: president trump says he could envisage a new trade pact with canada that might exclude mexico , reports bbc world service .
speaking at the white house with the visiting canadian prime minister , justin trudeau , mr trump said us workers had to be protected .

on tuesday the mexican foreign minister said that if the us tore up the north american free trade agreement ( nafta ) which covers the three countries , cross-border relations , including cooperation in the war on drugs , would suffer badly .
nafta oversees a trillion dollars in annual trade .

documents.title: mps launch inquiry into chicken supplier
text: the environment , food and rural affairs committee ( efra ) says it is to inquire into the allegations of food safety breaches at the 2 sisters food group .
earlier this month 2 sisters - one of the uk 's largest supermarket chicken suppliers - suspended operations after an investigation allegedly exposed food safety breaches .
the 2 sisters food group said staff at its site in the west midlands will need to be `` appropriately retrained '' before it starts resupplying customers .
the move came after allegations that workers had changed slaughter dates to extend the shelf life of meat .

among other things the mp 's inquiry will look into the `` potential ramifications of the allegations made against 2 sisters for the poultry sector and the wider food chain '' , the committee said in a statement .
later this month , it will take evidence from 2 sisters boss ranjit singh boparan , the food standards agency , assured food standards and the british poultry council .

documents.title: us federal reserve debates inflation
text: lagging inflation rates and what they mean for future increases in interest rates were a focus of the most recent meeting of the us central bank .
federal reserve policymakers are puzzled by the slow pace of price and wage increases , which they have attributed to temporary factors such as lower priced cell phone plans .
changes in future months will be hard to interpret because of the impact of hurricanes harvey , irma and maria .
but several members now expect it to take longer than previously forecast to hit the fed 's 2 % target rate for inflation , according to minutes released on wednesday .
many expect the fed to raise interest rates one more time before the end of the year .
but the minutes showed that several said they want to have more confidence that inflation is up before taking further action .
a few said they thought further increases should be deferred until higher inflation is confirmed .
`` all agreed that they would closely monitor and assess incoming data before making any further adjustment to the federal funds rate , '' the minutes said .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: watch : 'superyacht ' hotel opens
text: a new £ 25m luxury hotel built to resemble a superyacht has opened in southampton .
it is hoped the 85-bedroom harbour hotel on the waterfront at ocean village will gain a five-star rating .

documents.title: trump 's threat to nbc
text: us president donald trump has raised the prospect of challenging media licences for nbc news and other news networks after unfavourable reports .
he took aim at nbc , which made him a star on the apprentice , after it reported he wanted to boost america 's nuclear arsenal almost tenfold .
mr trump labelled the report `` fake news '' and `` pure fiction '' .
nbc also angered the white house last week when it said the secretary of state had called mr trump `` a moron '' .

documents.title: how the chancellor is preparing for a 'no deal ' brexit
text: how the chancellor is preparing for a 'no deal ' brexit

documents.title: more metres for your money ?
text: blaenau gwent homes are on average the cheapest per square metre in england and wales , new figures have shown .
homes in the south wales county were worth £ 777 per sq m in 2016 , versus £ 19,439 in the most expensive council area , kensington and chelsea .
the office for national statistics figures showed the average home in wales was worth £ 1,408 per sq m , compared to £ 2,463 in england .
the most expensive place to buy in wales was in cardiff .
read the full story here

documents.title: centrica 'welcomes ' ofgem 's tariff plans
text: more from centrica on its response to ofgem 's report ( see post at 3:12pm ) .
ofgem said it would have to wait for new legislation before it could take action on standard variable tariffs - the sometimes expensive price plans that have led to the most anger over energy bills .
in its statement centrica said with more than 50 energy suppliers in the uk there was `` intense competition in the market '' .
however it added : `` we agree more can be done to improve the functioning of the market , particularly regarding default tariffs and the nature of the standard variable tariff .
`` we therefore welcome ofgem 's intention to change the default mechanism at the end of fixed contracts , and to permit different default tariffs other than the standard variable tariff .

documents.title: facebook fault hits users
text: trending on twitter # facebookdown .
thousands of people are reporting on social media that they ca n't access their facebook or instagram accounts .
a facebook spokesperson told the bbc : we 're aware that some people are currently having trouble accessing facebook and instagram .
we 're working to get things back to normal as quickly as possible . ''

documents.title: monarch owner 'expects ppf to be paid in full '
text: greybull capital , which has owned monarch for the past three years , has put a more optimistic gloss on its indebtedness to the pension protection fund .

the owners of monarch say that if the administrators of the insolvent airline can sell its valuable landing slots at airports for enough money then there should be enough available to pay the ppf the £ 7.5m it is owed .
in a statement greybull said : the administrators are working to maximise the proceeds from the sale of assets .
if the recovery on assets is as speculated on in the press , we expect the ppf loan note to be paid in full . ''
author: Ian Pollock
Business reporter

documents.title: ppf 'owed £ 7.5m ' from monarch
text: the pension protection fund has confirmed that it is owed £ 7.5m from the now-collapsed monarch airline .
when the airline was sold for £ 1 back in 2014 , the ppf agreed to take on the monarch pension scheme and has been fully responsible for paying the pensioners since last year .
at the time , monarch agreed , among other things , to pay £ 7.5m to the ppf in three annual instalments - £ 2.5m this year , in 2018 and in 2019 .
that money may not now be paid , and the ppf has become a secured creditor joining the queue at the airline 's administrators kpmg .
the ppf expects eventually to receive just a few pence in the pound .
but the loss of the £ 7.5m would be small beer .
the assets which support all the pension scheme members it has rescued over the years - including those of monarch - stand at more than £ 30bn .
and that ppf fund has a surplus of £ 6bn , bolstered each year by a levy on solvent employers , who this year will pay in a further £ 615m .
author: Ian Pollock
Business reporter

documents.title: wall street in positive territory
text: let 's check in on how shares are doing in the us now - and whereas at the open the s & p 500 and nasdaq were in negative territory , things are looking a big more positive now .
the s & p 500 is now up at 2,552.67 , that 's 2 points or 0.08 % higher .
and the nasdaq has also risen to 6,595.50 , 8 points or 0.13 % up .
meanwhile the dow jones has extended its gains and is now at 22,850.67 , a rise of 20 points or 0.09 % .

documents.title: old £ 1 good in aldi for further fortnight
text: shoppers have been expressing their annoyance at receiving old £ 1 coins in change , ahead of the 15 october deadline when businesses can refuse to accept them .
tesco has already said it will take them for a week after the deadline .
now aldi has gone even further .
we 've been ready to accept the new £ 1 coins since they first came into circulation in march .
to make the transition as easy as possible for our customers , we will continue to accept the old £ 1 coins as payment across our stores until the 31st of october .
aldi will accept # roundpound coins for a fortnight after the 16 oct deadline .
tesco already said it wd take them for extra week # cash

documents.title: whitbread up and mondi down at london close
text: the ftse 100 was slightly lower at the close of trade on wednesday at 7,533.81 , that 's a fall of 4 points or 0.06 % .
whitbread shares were up by 3.4 % - the strongest gainers - after the company paid £ 35m to take full control of its costa coffee joint venture in china .
the biggest decline was seen by packaging and paper products maker , mondi , which warned on profits earlier today .
its shares finished the day 7.8 % lower .
the ftse 250 edged up a tad to 20,167.78 , that 's 21 points or 0.11 % higher .
homeware retailer dunelm saw the the biggest rise on the mid-cap index .
its shares rose by 6.3 % on wednesday after it said like-for-like sales jumped 9.3 % in the 13 weeks to 30 september .

documents.title: hurricane not as bad as thought for delta
text: us airline delta weathered the effects of hurricane irma to post better-than-expected earnings .
the carrier posted $ 1.7bn ( £ 1.29bn ) pre-tax profits for the three months to 30 september , $ 182m ( £ 138m ) lower than last year .
it was forced to cancel flights when the hurricane hit the caribbean , florida , georgia and delta 's hub in atlanta .
ed bastian , delta 's chief executive officer , said : we faced a number of challenges this quarter , including multiple hurricanes and an earthquake in mexico .
`` i am proud of how delta people responded and still delivered an outstanding performance this quarter . ''

documents.title: ppf 'better off ' than if monarch had failed in 2014
text: the ppf says if monarch had gone bust in 2014 , rather than being bought for £ 1 , the pension scheme would have received nothing .
as it was , the ppf and greybull came to an arrangement which saw £ 30m being pumped into the scheme .
in addition to the cash , the scheme also took debt in the business and a 10 % equity stake .
these were taken on the basis that if the business were to become successful again there would be a further return , '' the ppf said .
`` recent events have shown that , while we hope to receive some further recovery in respect of our debt , sadly monarch did not return to being a successful business .
`` despite this , we believe that the protections we negotiated in november 2014 to ensure our debt and equity could not be superseded or watered down have operated as intended . ''
the upshot ?
by agreeing to a restructuring in 2014 , the ppf says it 's `` better off '' than if monarch had been allowed to fail back then .

documents.title: monarch pensioners getting 'much more ' under ppf
text: the pension protection fund ( ppf ) has reacted to the work and pensions committee 's questions about the monarch airlines pension scheme .
in november 2014 the monarch pension scheme was heavily deficit and the ppf faced an `` inevitable claim of £ 200m '' , the ppf said in its statement .
`` without the protection of the ppf that shortfall in the pension scheme would have meant very significant losses to members .
following the transfer of the scheme to the ppf in november 2016 , members are receiving much more than the pension scheme could have afforded to pay , '' it added .

documents.title: lufthansa to buy air berlin assets say reports
text: lufthansa is on the verge of agreeing a deal to snap up assets from insolvent air berlin , a source has told reuters .

germany 's biggest airline will buy air berlin 's niki leisure unit , its lg walter regional airline and some additional short-haul aircraft , the source said , adding , `` the deal with lufthansa is done , there is agreement . ''
lufthansa did not comment on whether it was about to sign a deal .

documents.title: frank field queries monarch pensions deal
text: the chair of the work and pension committee frank field has written to the chief executive of the pension protection fund ( ppf ) with some questions about the monarch airlines pension scheme .
the ppf took over the running of the pension scheme when greybull capital bought monarch for £ 1 in 2014 .
the questions centre around whether a £ 7.5m owed to the ppf by greybull capital will be paid in full .
under the terms of the arrangement the ppf had been due to receive the money in instalments .
media reports have raised the possibility that because of the way the buyout was structured , the ppf may lose out entirely on its claim while greybull could make a big profit from its investment .
mr field said : how can it be that once again , mega rich individuals could walk away from a collapsed company with a bumper profit while ordinary people up the bill ?

`` this massively supports the case for the law to change , to robustly protect pension schemes against owners seeking to line their pockets while avoiding their responsibilities , in line with our recommendations .
do we need another illustration of the ethics of some of the billionaire class in this country before we act ? ''

documents.title: spot the difference
text: talking business presenter aaron heslehurst 's body language bears more than a passing resemblance to sharon stone 's infamous leg cross in the basic instinct film as eagle eyed viewer alex kunawicz has pointed out .
that 's hilarious ! !
did you miss the shot when i crossed over my legs ?

documents.title: mps will 'hold equifax boss to his words '
text: in its statement issued on tuesday equifax 's chief european executive , patricio remon , said : `` once again , i would like to extend my most sincere apologies to anyone who has been concerned about or impacted by this criminal act . ''
mr remon also said the immediate focus of equifax was to 'support those affected by this incident ' .

treasury committee chair , nicky morgan , said the committee would `` hold him to these words , and will consider taking public evidence from equifax , particularly if it does not receive a full and timely response to these questions '' .

documents.title: mps demand answers about equifax breach
text: on tuesday , credit reference agency equifax admitted that 694,000 customers in the uk had their data stolen between may and july this year .
the firm 's original estimate of its uk cyber-theft victims , made last month , was fewer , at nearly 400,000 .

now chair of the treasury committee , nicky morgan , has written to the chief executive of equifax in the uk asking for further details about the scale of the breach , and what compensation it will provide .
equifax has taken too long to notify those affected by its widespread cyber-security breach .
people have been left in the dark for too long , which has increased the risk that they fall victim to identity theft and fraud .

it is particularly concerning that the breach occurred in a business that sells identity protection services , and is looking to take advantage of the commercial opportunities afforded by data sharing initiatives , such as open banking .

documents.title: centrica agrees with ofgem
text: the energy regulator , ofgem , has said it will extend its prepayment price cap to one million vulnerable households this winter .
it said it was looking at extending price protection to another two million next winter , after the government announces its price cap ( see previous posts ) .
now the uk 's biggest energy supplier centrica has responded .
it says it agrees that more vulnerable customers should receive price protection , beyond those on pre-payment meters .
`` this is in line with our own recent voluntary actions to protect an additional 200,000 customers for the whole of this winter , '' it adds .

documents.title: mazda ' investigating ' kobe 's steel in bonnets
text: japan 's third-biggest steelmaker kobe steel has admitted fabricating data about the strength and durability of some aluminium and copper products ( see earlier posts ) .
now a mazda spokesperson has told the bbc : `` we use kobe steel aluminium on bonnets of cars . ''
however , the company is still `` investigating what vehicles that metal is in and deciding what action we need to take '' .
mazda `` wo n't know if we need to take any action until those investigations are complete , '' they added .

documents.title: little change on wall street
text: on wall street , all three key share indexes edged down at the start of wednesday 's trading amid caution about third quarter bank results which are due this week
`` third quarter results of large banks are expected to be tepid , '' said stephen biggar , an analyst at argus research .
`` trading revenue ( will be ) down due to low volatility and loan growth remaining flat to slightly negative . ''
however , a short while ago the dow jones was ahead by 7 points or 0.03 % at 22,837.37 .
the s & p 500 was at 2,550.14 , a fall of 0.5 points or 0.02 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq was at 6,583.64 , down 4 points or 0.05 % .

documents.title: ebay explains tax affairs
text: the uk arm of ebay paid only £ 1.6m in corporation tax last year , even though the us company had total revenues from its uk operations of $ 1.32bn ( £ 1bn ) .
ebay is a huge international business that makes money mainly from advertisers and the commission on sales made through its auction site .
the company declined to explain how its uk revenues were not booked though its uk business .
an ebay spokesman said its tax affairs were entirely legal .

`` in all countries and at all times , ebay is fully compliant with national , eu and international tax rules including those of the oecd , including the remittance of vat to the appropriate authorities , '' he said .

documents.title: have you had money taken from your bank account ?
text: if you have been in the unfortunate position of having money removed from your bank account , then radio 4 's money box want to hear from you .

documents.title: scottish airport passenger numbers taking off
text: passenger numbers at aberdeen airport have increased for the fifth month in a row , despite a further fall in helicopter traffic .
nearly 285,000 people used the airport in september , a year-on-year increase of 3.9 % .
meanwhile , edinburgh airport reported its busiest september on record , following a surge in international passenger numbers .
a total of almost 1.3 million people used the airport last month - up 8.4 % on the same period last year .
international traffic was up by 14.1 % over the period .

documents.title: want your energy questions answered ?
text: wondering how your energy bills will be affected by a price cap ?
tweet me your question and i 'll do my best to answer on @ twitterid # drive

documents.title: donate your old pound coins to pudsey
text: if you still have some old pound coins lying around in pockets and down the back of the sofa , why not put them to good use by donating them to this year 's bbc children in need ?
the appeal has launched pudsey 's round pound countdown to encourage people to donate the old round coins to the fund via special boxes in banks , building societies and some retail outlets .
this year 's children in need takes place on friday 17 november .

documents.title: the company meeting music demand in china
text: the company meeting music demand in china

documents.title: from disney to pompey
text: why would the former head of disney take over a lower division english football club ?
business reporter bill wilson finds out .

documents.title: alibaba pledges $ 15bn investment
text: online retail giant alibaba is showing off its might .
it 's said it will invest a whopping $ 15bn to build overseas research hubs as it tries to take on rivals such as amazon .

the alibaba `` damo '' academy will include eight research bases in china , israel , the us , russia and singapore and initially it will hire 100 researchers to work on artificial intelligence ( ai ) , quantum computing and fintech , the company has said .

documents.title: hurricane irma hits delta profits
text: delta has reported much better-than-expected third quarter results .
the us airline said for the three months to september revenue rose 5.5 % to $ 11.1bn compared to the same period last year , just ahead of expectations .
net profit fell 6 % to $ 1.17bn , largely due to disruptions caused by hurricane irma .
the storm caused widespread destruction across the caribbean and killed at least nine people .

documents.title: bombardier workers lobby mps
text: mps have joined bombardier workers outside the houses of parliament as part of a campaign to protect jobs in belfast .
the workers , along with the trade union , unite , displayed a large banner stating `` # backbombardier '' .
the group is due to meet business secretary greg clark later .
bombardier , a canadian aerospace company , is in a trade dispute with rival firm boeing over alleged below-cost selling of its c-series jet .

documents.title: toyota and honda probe kobe impact
text: japan 's third-largest steelmaker , kobe steel , has admitted fabricating data about the strength and durability of some aluminium and copper products .
toyota , honda and subaru are among the carmakers to have used products that could be part of the falsification .
a toyota spokesperson says it is working to identify if any vehicles had been affected and through which components .
meanwhile , honda says aluminium made by kobe steel , during the period in question , had been used in the doors and bonnets of some cars .
`` we are carrying out further investigations to understand the full impact , '' a honda spokesperson says .

documents.title: 'deathly dull ' wednesday
text: it 's not just the weather that 's a bit grey .
the stock market 's looking decidedly bland as well .
spreadex analyst connor campbell sums it up as a `` deathly dull wednesday '' .
the only significant mover is spain 's ibex which is still up 1.4 % .
otherwise the ftse , germany 's dax and france 's cac indexes are all pretty much flat .

`` with the fomc [ federal open market committee ] meeting minutes release this evening still the main event , there does n't seem to be much on offer to inspire any excitement , '' mr campbell adds .

documents.title: japanese steel company 's value plummets
text: japan 's kobe steel saw more than $ 1.5bn in market value wiped out in two days after admitting to faking product data .
earlier on # bbcbizlive

documents.title: merlin not in talks with seaworld
text: if you were hoping your annual merlin pass would soon cover visits to seaworld in the us then you 're not in luck .
uk-based entertainment giant merlin - which runs legoland theme parks round the world and also owns madam tussauds and the london eye - says it 's not in talks to buy seaworld .
there were reports last week that a possible deal was on the horizon .

text: donald trump is at it again , claiming credit for the latest stock market rally .
and it 's true that since the election , the dow is up 24.23 % , the s & p 500 is up 19.28 % and the nasdaq is up 26.8 % .
market analysts say that simply the presence of trump has fueled confidence with many investors expecting the president to deliver tax reform or at least a significant cut to corporate taxes

make america wealthy again ! .
under trump make america wealthy again ! .
ahhh - a russian bot
original americans ! .
stand with america not russia ! .
# maga

documents.title: dove ad 'was not racist '
text: lola ogunyemi is the black model who appeared in the controversial dove advertisement that has been branded racist .
she tells bbc breakfast that said stills mostly showing only her and a white woman , but leaving out an asian woman , gave the wrong impression .
however , the londoner admits dove should have spotted the risk that the sequence of images could be interpreted as racist .
the model at the centre of the dove advert branded as 'racist ' says she would make it again @ twitterid @ twitterid
and what charity has she donated her fee to ?
surely she would n't keep racists money !
she 's great .

that was its fault .

it 's something that people of colour are constantly subjected to .
i would n't necessarily expect all to understand
she would make it again , cos it was not racist !
we do not need her permission to point out the racism in it .

author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: labour want quick government action over energy cap
text: shadow business secretary rebecca long-bailey has demanded quick action from the government over the energy price cap issue .
`` the government needs to hurry up and get on with it if customers are to feel the benefit this winter , '' she said .
`` it is now mid-october and we are yet to have sight of the legislation , despite labour 's persistent calls for the government to take action .
`` not only is timely legislation necessary , when published it must compel ofgem to implement a cap rather than simply handing over a power which they may or may not use .
`` a labour government will immediately introduce an emergency price cap while we transition to a fairer system for bill payers . ''

documents.title: will brexit lead to data sharing risk ? treasury committee
text: at the treasury committee , conservative kit malthouse asks if it is necessary to have customs checks in place the day after the uk leaves the eu .
if we did it a month later it would make no difference , he suggests .
philip hammond acknowledges that currently lorries can roll into dover unchecked , but says that the system happens `` in the context '' of data sharing with the eu .

`` lets be blunt , '' he says and suggests that the uk has to prepare for a scenario in which - because of `` bad-tempered breakdown of negotiations '' - there is no data sharing with the eu the day after the uk leaves the union .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: amazon in booths tie-up
text: amazonfresh customers in the south-east of england will now be able to buy products from posh northern supermarket booths after the two struck a deal .
booths chairman edwin booth says the `` northern secret '' will now reach `` a wide range of shoppers '' .
amazon launched its supermarket service more than a year ago , heaping yet more pressure on the already squeezed sector .

documents.title: us or eu ? asks conservative mptreasury committee
text: conservative mp stephen hammond notes that the us regulatory authorities are looking to `` pull down '' regulations .
should we align our financial system with the americans or the eu ?
he asks .
philip hammond replies that if us `` gets out of alignment '' that would be `` an additional complication '' .
he says that he does not want to expose the uk taxpayer to the `` kind of risks '' that led to the financial crisis .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: nikkei closes at 21-year high
text: tokyo 's main stock market index closed at its highest level in more than two decades on wednesday as optimism spread across global markets .
the nikkei 225 added 0.3 % , or 57.7 points , to end at 20,881.2 .
it was the best finish for the index since 1996 and follows fresh record highs on wall street overnight .
the 21-year high comes in spite of the continuing problems at japan 's kobe steel , which has lost more than $ 1.5bn ( £ 1.1bn ) in market value in two days .
shares in japan 's third largest steelmaker fell nearly 18 % on wednesday , and 22 % the previous day after it admitted falsifying product data .
in contrast to the nikkei 's gains , hong kong 's hang seng index fell 101.26 points , or nearly 0.4 % , to close at 28,389.57 .

documents.title: labour mp asks about customs checks in irelandtreasury committee
text: more from the treasury committee where labour mp alison mcgovern asks the chancellor how the government can implement checks on goods and immigration between northern ireland and ireland without building a physical infrastructure .
philip hammond says that an excise regime `` which works pretty well '' is already in place ( without the need for hard infrastructure ) on certain goods such as cigarettes and alcohol .
he adds that the issue has n't been resolved with the eu yet as our future relationship with the union is unclear .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: ready to eat your coffee cup ?
text: it 's mid-morning so the time that a lot of people will reach for a coffee .
some will drink it at home and some at work , while a lot of people will one up to go at any of the numerous coffee shops around the country .
but what will happen to those empty takeaway cups once they have been drained ?
coffee cup recycling is becoming a major issue but there are solutions at hand - including the edible cup !
read more of lucy hooker 's report here .

documents.title: hammond : the eu knows we mean businesstreasury committee
text: back at the treasury committee , conservative charlie elphicke returns to the subject of spending money to prepare for a no deal brexit .
chancellor philip hammond acknowledges that `` some are urging me to spend money '' to send a message to the eu that `` we mean business '' .
mr elphicke asks why the chancellor does n't just make the investments in , for example , `` world class customs systems '' .
`` it 's not investment we need anyway , '' replies mr hammond , adding that any investment would be specific to a no deal outcome .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: your energy bills explained
text: personal finance and consumer affairs reporter kevin peachey explains what will happen to the price you pay for your home energy supplies after ofgem 's announcement that a price cap on energy bills proposed by the prime minister last week is unlikely to take effect before winter .
what the @ twitterid announcement means for you and your # energy bills

documents.title: chancellor urges eu to engage with uk on transition dealtreasury committee
text: labour mp wes streeting asks if the outlines of a transition deal can be made public before businesses make irreversible decisions .
the chancellor says the prime minister made a clear proposal for an interim period in her florence speech and that the government is not awaiting a response from the eu .
`` we need our european partners to engage with us , '' he adds .
he says a transition period is `` a wasting asset '' the value of which will diminish as time goes on .
`` there is a need for speed . ''
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: follow philip hammond at treasury committee live
text: you can watch chancellor philip hammond being questioned right now live on bbc parliament via iplayer or you can follow live text updates on the questions and answers here .

documents.title: hammond : many mps do not understand role of fpctreasury committee
text: snp mp stewart hosie asks if he believes the public understand the role of the financial policy committee ( fpc ) .
the fpc is responsible for monitoring risks taken by banks and take action to protect stability in the sector .
the public , and many mps , do not have a deep understanding of committee 's role , replies mr hammond .
should they make more speeches in public ?
asks mr hosie .
we do not control speeches made by members of the fpc , replies the chancellor .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: global stocks hit all-time high
text: spanish stocks have now helped to drive global stocks to an all-time high .
they hit a fresh all-time high on the msci world index , albeit briefly .

`` there was a chance carles puigdemont [ catalan leader ] would have made a decisive declaration , so now yields are dropping because there is room for negotiation left , '' says dz bank strategist christian lenk .

documents.title: uncertainty on future affecting economy , says hammond
text: chancellor philip hammond has just told the treasury select committee that the uncertainty around brexit talks is having an effect on the uk economy .
`` my general view on the economy is that it is fundamentally robust and we have some very positive things going on , with a strong outlook for the future , '' he said .
`` however , the cloud of uncertainty over current negotiations is acting as a temporary dampener and we need to remove it as soon as possible to make some progress .
`` there is plenty of anecdotal evidence that businesses and consumers are waiting to see what the outcome is before firming up investment decisions . ''

documents.title: location , location , location
text: economics editor kamal ahmed dissects the official stats on house prices per square metre .
1sq m of floor space costs £ 19,439 in kensington & chelsea .
in blaenau gwent the same amount of space costs £ 777 @ twitterid
imagine you could commute by plane to london and still save money
# relocatetoblaenow now !
so , what is your point ?
it is only £ 250 /sq m in central leeds for grade a office rental .
to rent or to build ?
try living in hk where the cost can easily double that !
band d council tax : k & c £ 782 ; blaenau gwent £ 1700 .
i 'd rather be in kensington and chelsea .
absolutely ridiculous is n't it .

documents.title: euro gets spanish boost
text: relief over catalonia has also pushed the euro to a two-week high , at €1.184 .
it 's the first time that it 's been above $ 1.18 since the 1 october vote .
but analysts remain wary .
stephen innes , head of asia-pacific trading at oanda , said that while the euro rose it `` gained little traction as this is little more than kicking the can down the road .
`` it 's unlikely we 've heard the last of this debate despite cooler heads prevailing , '' he says .

documents.title: spanish stocks surge
text: spanish stocks are leading the way in european stock marks this morning .
the country 's regional benchmark ibex is up 1.6 % , easily outperforming the mere 0.1 % rise of the pan-european stoxx 600 index .
spanish equities have lagged their european peers this month due to concerns over the impact of catalonia 's independence referendum .

but the fact that catalan leader carles puigdemont last night stopped short of declaring independence last night and instead said he would allow negotiations appears to have reassured investors for now at least .

documents.title: price cap 'a difficult issue '
text: dermot nolan , chief executive of the energy regulator ofgem , gave a less-than-ringing endorsement of theresa may 's flagship price-caps plan this morning - a difficult issue '' , he said , noting it had split '' the competition and markets authority , and that his organisation will try and make it work '' so that average prices would fall .
mr nolan , perhaps , sees the next twist in the price cap saga 's plot .

the big six energy suppliers , spurred into action by may 's threats , are making plans to scrap the standard variable tariff - the ( sometimes ) expensive price plan that has led to the most anger over energy bills .

e.on has already stopped offering the standard variable tariff , instead forcing customers to make a positive choice of the kind of deal they would like , and centrica 's chief executive ian conn , gave a heavy hint that he would like his uk operation , british gas , to do something similar .
it would be a fitting end to a torturous tale if price caps for standard variable tariffs were introduced in a year 's time - only for those tariffs to have melted away in the meantime .
author: Dominic O'Connell
Business Presenter, BBC Radio 4 Today programme

documents.title: emirates moots etihad cooperation
text: interesting mood music from dubai 's emirates today .
the airline 's president , tim clark , says it is open to cooperation with abu dhabi-based arch rival etihad on areas that could include procurement .
while a full merger is unlikely , he says that is up to the airlines ' owners .
`` i think there is value to be had working more closely with them , '' mr clark told reuters .
he conceded there might be concerns from regulators in some foreign markets , however .
the gulf carriers have been battered by falling demand and other headwinds in recent months , forcing some creative thinking .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: worldstores weighs on dunelm margins
text: homeware retailer dunelm says its merger with homewares rival , worldstores , could weigh on the company 's margins but said sales had improved .

dunelm , which paid £ 8.5m for worldstores , kiddicare and achica owner ws group last year , said total sales had increased 24.8 % to £ 247.9m in the 13 weeks to 30 september - but that margins would be `` down slightly '' .
like-for-like sales , which strips out the effect of new stores , went up by 9.3 % .

chairman andy harrison says the merger was `` on plan '' and making `` good progress '' , adding : `` we head into the second quarter having opened a number of new stores and with an improved seasonal offer for the christmas period , which we 're sure will resonate well with customers . ''

documents.title: london 's 'chronic lack of supply ' boosts housebuilder
text: telford homes is confident london 's `` chronic '' housing shortage will fuel property sales , but said the timing of transactions meant profits would fall in the first half of its financial year .
the housebuilder , which builds homes to sell and rent , said income would fall during the six months to october , but that it expects full-year profits to grow from £ 34m to £ 40m .
boss jon di-stefano says : `` our ultimate belief in what we do is underpinned by a chronic lack of supply and we expect to deliver more of the homes that london needs in the coming years . ''
it plans to build 4,000 homes across the capital to buy and rent - with an average asking price of £ 530,000 .

documents.title: just for pets is back in business
text: struggling pet chain just for pets has been rescued from the administrators by a supply firm - although seven of its 25 stores are due to close .

buyer pedigree wholesale , which supplies pet , aquatic and garden centre products to shops , plans to keep 200 jobs but said just for pets will close in evesham , burton-upon-trent , northampton , nottingham , reading , wellington , yardley .
managing director steve brown , of pedigree wholesale , says : `` we felt we could play a role in using our pet business expertise '' .
he added : `` we know just for pets has a great reputation for offering outstanding customer service and has developed a loyal customer base . ''

documents.title: indian ride-sharing firm ola raises $ 1.1bn
text: ola has pulled further ahead of rival uber in the huge indian ride-sharing market .
the company has raised $ 1.1bn ( £ 833m ) from investors led by china 's tencent and japan 's softbank .
ola has said it will use the funds to increase the number of drivers and expand to more cities .
the firm has been battling uber for a bigger slice of india 's $ 12bn taxi market .
ola , which operates in 110 indian cities , has a number of transport options including bikes , rickshaws and electric cars .
uber is available in about 30 cities .

documents.title: ofgem boss suggests it may be forced on legislation
text: ofgem boss dermot nolan has now moved onto 5 live breakfast .
mr nolan says he expects legislation to give regulator the power and the duty '' to impose a price cap .
presenter guy kilty says the significance of this is that up until now it 's been up to ofgem whether it decides to implement a price cap .
this suggests mr nolan expects the government to force ofgem to do it .
@ ofgem boss tells @ twitterid he anticipates govt will give regulator `` the power & the duty '' to impose standard var price cap # wakeuptomoney

documents.title: bombardier workers to meet mps
text: a group of bombardier workers from belfast are due to meet mps later in an effort to press the government over a trade dispute that threatens jobs at the aerospace firm .
rival firm boeing had accused bombardier of alleged below-cost selling of its c-series jet .
the us government imposed an import tax of 80 % on the jets , on top of a 220 % tariff already set .
the wings for the c-series are made in belfast .

documents.title: nothing to see here
text: mondi is one of those ftse 100 companies you 've probably never heard of .
it makes packaging and paper products , by the way , and is worth £ 10bn - that 's almost twice as much as sainsbury 's or morrisons , by way of comparison .
it has a trading update out this morning , and thanks to garry white of charles stanley we now know that mondi is warning on profits - but you 'd have to be a patient reader to find that out .
shares are down 7 % so far today , making it the biggest faller on the ftse .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: 'get customers off standard variable tariffs '
text: the ofgem boss is clear on what he thinks of standard variable tariffs .
`` i challenge energy companies to get their customers off standard variable tariffs and on to better deals '' - dermot nolan , ofgem chief exec
i challenge people to do it themselves , it 's easy .
learned helplessness
people have v busy lives , if parents e.g .
both working .
then there might be caring for parents .
it takes 5 minutes .
should n't have to do it !
it makes no difference anyway as they 're operating a cartel .
name one useful thing ofgem has done for consumers ?
ofgem is useless like most of the other regulators .
but when offered two prices you are lazy if you accept the highest one .
the point i 've been trying to get across via these tweets is that it 's not ime a clear , easy choice on price .
did mine only a few months ago and uswitch made it easy to compare .
i really find it hard to understand they do the hard work .
well maybe your experience is different , that 's all i can suggest
should n't market forces be doing that ?
ha ha ha
it 's an ambition of mine to get more people laughing on twitter , so cheers !

dermot nolan , brother of phil nolan was boss of transco , let 's keep it in the family eh .
conflict of interests .

excellent interview .
loved nolan 's ultra calm cool responses .
particularly liked his response to jh 's remark about his voice .
more please !
yes but he should 've asked him how his brother ex transco boss is doing ?
they 're all in it together .
or better still , switch to a green energy supplier and not one propping up the disgusting fracking industry , like the big 6 do .
wr have to stop this
we are the only country selling our utilities to foreign investors
why is it the responsibility of the companies to get people off standard tariffs .
why is it not the responsibility of the individual .
look at the growth of renewables and of battery storage capacity .
be great if all homes/communities had solar/wind power and a battery .

documents.title: ofgem : we 're working on it
text: `` we 're working on it , '' is ofgem chief executive dermot nolan 's response to claims that the government 's proposal to cap energy prices could be delayed .
`` the timing of it i ca n't give you precisely .
that will depend on the legislative process , '' he tells the today programme .
while reports suggestion legislation could take as long as 14 months , mr nolan says `` he wo n't speculate '' .
he also shifts the responsibility for reducing customers ' bills onto energy firms , saying that they should be moving all customers off standard variable tariffs because they 're `` a bad deal '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: tokyo at 21-year high
text: meanwhile in japan the benchmark index ended at its highest level in more than two decades on wednesday , as investors in tokyo join in on a global market rally .
the nikkei 225 added 0.3 % , or 57.7 points , to close at 20,881.2 .
that 's its best finish since 1996 .
solid corporate results and an upbeat mood on us markets - with a recent string of records on wall street - have helped spur gains in japan .

documents.title: ftse becalmed
text: the london market is flat as a pancake as trading gets underway for another day , rising about 2 points to 7,538 .

documents.title: safe and sound ?
text: technology correspondent rory cellan-jones tweets :

as england 's greatest living poet , the bard of salford , dr. john cooper clarke once said full of pornography , the kind that 's clean ''

documents.title: internet green paper to be launched
text: culture secretary karen bradley has announced the launch of a green paper to try to regulate the internet .
she told the today programme : `` it is the first step in the process for the government and others in this area about how to make the internet the safest place to be online .
`` there are lots of things we can do .
we are consulting on a social media code of conduct so that social media companies abide by certain principles and certain approaches .
we are looking to make it voluntary , although i do n't rule out legislation if that 's what we need to do .

`` we are also looking at what schools and parents can do , it is a collaborative approach and we want to understand all the things that we can do , so that we can make sure people are safe online and that we reach the point where what you do on your computer screen is the same behaviour as if you were meeting somebody in the street . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: hargreaves lansdown 'solid start '
text: hargreaves lansdown says it has had `` a solid start '' to the new financial year .
the stockbroker says assets under administration grew four per cent to £ 82bn over the three months to 30 september and that it gained 30,000 new clients .
overall , the company posted a £ 1.54bn jump in net new business for the period .
revenues surged 15 % to £ 104.1m .

documents.title: draft legislation on cap due this week
text: the department for business , energy and industrial strategy says that despite the apparent delay on the implementation of theresa may 's proposed energy cap that draft legislation will be published this week .

`` we have been clear that this market needs reforming and as the prime minister announced , we will publish draft legislation on an energy price cap covering all customers on default tariffs this week , '' a spokesperson says .

documents.title: tesco vision express deal moves closer
text: the uk 's competition and markets authority ( cma ) said in august that it was investigating vision express 's deal to buy tesco 's opticians to probe whether the proposed tie-up will create a substantial lessening of competition '' .
vision express has since offered to divest the vision express store in each of the three local areas in which competition concerns were identified .
the cma says it now believes `` the undertakings offered , or a modified version of them , might be accepted by the cma to remedy the substantial lessening of competition '' .
it says it will decide by 7 december whether to accept the undertakings .
